summary: This bill, the National Gun Violence Research Act of 2025, establishes a national research program to study gun violence. It aims to examine its causes, consequences, and prevention. It directs the President, through the Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy, to develop and implement the program. It includes provisions for grant funding, interagency coordination, an advisory committee, and outlines specific agency activities, including research grants to the NSF, development of safety standards by NIST, research by HHS, and data sharing by the DOJ.
